## Steps to reproduce
- Teach someone about PowerShell and its built-in remote capabilities
- Show them the magic of Get-Service <someservice> -ComputerName A,B,C
- They ask you if you can pipe the results to Stop- or Start-Service to run on multiple machines
- Experience the joy of telling your children there is no Santa again, when you tell them that Stop-Service and Stop-Process don't have `-ComputerName` support.
- Their eyes glaze over when you explain that you _can_ do it in WMI instead.
## Expected behavior

`Stop-Process` should have `-ComputerName` support.  It stinks today to have to use an ugly `Get-WMIobject` cmdlet instead to actually enact changes on remote processes or services.
## Actual behavior

If you try to Pipe the results of `Get-Process` or`Get-Service` to its matching Start or Stop cmdlet, PowerShell tries to make changes ON YOUR LOCAL PC instead.
